Fed Chair to give high-stakes speech at Jackson Hole symposium amid pressure from Trump
subhead: Jerome Powell, chair of the US central bank, will deliver his final address of his term on Friday at the annual gathering of top financial policymakers in Jackson Hole, Wyoming. His speech is highly anticipated, coming at a moment when the Fed faces criticism and its independence is threatened by Donald Trump.

title: War in Ukraine: Russia targets cities as Ukrainians strike energy infrastructure
subhead: While Russia has launched 574 Shahed drones against Ukraine, Kyiv has managed to hit Russian energy infrastructure, forcing Crimea to ration fuel at service stations.

title: Death of French streamer: Behind Kick, an Australian crypto casino and two young billionaires
subhead: The livestreaming platform began as an offshoot of one of the world's largest online gambling sites: Stake. From the outset, lax moderation was part of its DNA.

title: How the 2024 Olympics transformed Greater Paris into a supersized stadium
subhead: Previously unpublished data on visitor numbers in Paris and its suburbs during the 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games reveal how the city and its residents adapted, and how the Games accelerated Paris's transformation.

subhead: 'Letters from America' (1/6). The writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams has been startled by the omnipresence of artificial intelligence at university, which he believes threatens the very foundations of education and our ability to think.

title: In the Donbas, a Ukrainian high schooler's rebellion against Russification
subhead: At her Russian-controlled high school near Luhansk, a pro-Ukrainian teenager who resisted propaganda was the target of relentless disciplinary action since January. Fearing that she could be placed in foster care or even adopted, her mother decided to flee the occupied territory.

title: Macron vows to 'defend my honor' amid viral smear campaign against his wife
subhead: The French president addressed the false claim that his wife, Brigitte Macron, was born a man in an interview with 'Paris Match.' He said he was prepared to pursue legal action 'all the way' to ensure the main spreaders of the lie are held accountable.
